title: AWS Lambda Function URL Authentication Bypass

timeline.event: Authentication bypass discovered in Lambda Function URLs
AWS confirms vulnerability affects IAM auth type
AWS releases fix and updated documentation

simple_summary.what_happened: A vulnerability was found in AWS Lambda Function URLs that use IAM authentication. Under certain conditions, attackers can bypass authentication by manipulating request headers. This allows unauthorized access to Lambda functions that should be protected.
simple_summary.who_is_affected: AWS customers using Lambda Function URLs with IAM authentication type. Functions that rely solely on Function URL authentication without additional authorization checks are vulnerable.
simple_summary.what_attackers_do: Step 1: Attacker identifies Lambda Function URLs through reconnaissance. Step 2: They craft requests with manipulated authentication headers. Step 3: The Lambda service incorrectly validates the request. Step 4: Unauthorized access to the Lambda function is granted. Step 5: Attackers can invoke functions, access data, and potentially pivot to other resources.
what_you_should_do: Review all Lambda Function URLs in your account
Add application-level authorization checks in your Lambda code
Consider using API Gateway with Lambda authorizers instead
Enable CloudWatch Logs and monitor for unusual invocations
Use resource-based policies to restrict Function URL access
simple_summary.why_this_is_serious: Lambda functions often have access to databases, secrets, and other AWS services. An authentication bypass means attackers can access your business logic and data without credentials. Since Function URLs are publicly accessible endpoints, they're easy targets for automated attacks.

tactics.description: Attackers exploit the publicly accessible Function URL endpoint

detection_guidance.summary: Monitor Lambda invocations for unusual patterns, unauthorized callers, and requests with suspicious headers. Enable Function URL access logging.

log_sources.description: Lambda invoke API calls and Function URL access
If WAF is in front of Function URLs

what_to_look_for.description: Lambda invocations without valid IAM context
Invocations from unexpected clients or tools

immediate_actions.description: Identify all Lambda functions with Function URLs enabled
Implement application-level authorization in your Lambda code
Ensure Function URL resource policies restrict access appropriately
Turn on CloudWatch Logs for all affected functions
